title: How to Make a No‐Bake Milk Toblerone Cheesecake

steps.headline: Grease and line a 20 centimeter (7.9 in) round spring-form pan.
steps.description: Line the base and sides with some baking (parchment) paper, extending approximately 2 centimeter (0.8 in) above the edge of the pan.

steps.headline: Melt the butter.
steps.description: This will be added to the crumb mixture next and it's much easier to do when it has been melted.

steps.headline: Place the Oreo cookies, shortbread biscuits and melted butter in a food processor.
steps.description: Process until the mixture is well combined and produces fine crumbs. Use a blender if you don't have a food processor. If you have neither a processor or a blender, crush the cookies first in a plastic bag, by repeatedly rolling a rolling pin over the cookies in the bag. Then tip out the cookie and biscuit crumbs into a separate bowl and combine with the butter by stirring.

steps.headline: Add the finely crumbed mixture to the base of the prepared pan.
steps.description: Using the tips of your fingers, press into the base of the pan, causing the mixture to flatten and form a joined base. Ensure that the base is even and reaches to the edges.

steps.headline: Place the dish into the refrigerator, preferably covered.
steps.description: Refrigerate the base while preparing the filling.

steps.headline: Beat the cream cheese and sugar in a large bowl using an electric mixer.
steps.description: Beat until it's light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Melt the toblerone, either using a double boiler or the microwave.
steps.description: Beat in the cooled, melted chocolate. Beat until smooth.

steps.headline: Whip the cream if not already done.
steps.description: Using a spatula, fold in the whipped cream until just combined with the other filling ingredients.

steps.headline: Spoon the filling into prepared pan.
steps.description: Ensure that it covers all areas of the cookie base. Use the bottom of the spoon (or the side of the spatula) to smooth over the top. The top should appear as even as possible.

steps.headline: Cover and refrigerate the dish for several hours.
steps.description: It is fine to leave it to set overnight. To cover, use a lid, a clean cloth or an upturned large plate.

steps.headline: Prepare the cheesecake for serving.
steps.description: To serve, shave some of the remaining Toblerone chocolate over the top of the cheesecake using a vegetable peeler.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Cut the cheesecake into even sizes for serving. Diners can either help themselves to pieces or you can plate up and add some whipped cream or berry coulis on the side.

text: Making the Cheesecake Base Grease and line a 20 centimeter (7.9 in) round spring-form pan. Line the base and sides with some baking (parchment) paper, extending approximately 2 centimeter (0.8 in) above the edge of the pan. Melt the butter. This will be added to the crumb mixture next and it's much easier to do when it has been melted. Place the Oreo cookies, shortbread biscuits and melted butter in a food processor. Process until the mixture is well combined and produces fine crumbs. Use a blender if you don't have a food processor. If you have neither a processor or a blender, crush the cookies first in a plastic bag, by repeatedly rolling a rolling pin over the cookies in the bag. Then tip out the cookie and biscuit crumbs into a separate bowl and combine with the butter by stirring. Add the finely crumbed mixture to the base of the prepared pan. Using the tips of your fingers, press into the base of the pan, causing the mixture to flatten and form a joined base. Ensure that the base is even and reaches to the edges. Place the dish into the refrigerator, preferably covered. Refrigerate the base while preparing the filling. Making the Cheesecake Filling Beat the cream cheese and sugar in a large bowl using an electric mixer. Beat until it's light and fluffy. Melt the toblerone, either using a double boiler or the microwave. Beat in the cooled, melted chocolate. Beat until smooth. Whip the cream if not already done. Using a spatula, fold in the whipped cream until just combined with the other filling ingredients. Spoon the filling into prepared pan. Ensure that it covers all areas of the cookie base. Use the bottom of the spoon (or the side of the spatula) to smooth over the top. The top should appear as even as possible. Cover and refrigerate the dish for several hours. It is fine to leave it to set overnight. To cover, use a lid, a clean cloth or an upturned large plate. Serving the Cheesecake Prepare the cheesecake for serving. To serve, shave some of the remaining Toblerone chocolate over the top of the cheesecake using a vegetable peeler. Serve. Cut the cheesecake into even sizes for serving. Diners can either help themselves to pieces or you can plate up and add some whipped cream or berry coulis on the side. Finished.
